title: FirmWars
author: FirmWars
content: If you are called upon to work for a decentralized exchange like Uniswap or Binance exchange which is a Centralised exchange, which offers will you grant yes? Assuming the payment or salary is the exact same amount every month which one will you prefer to work for and why?

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: I will base my choice on the job specification and have to analyze which of the two fits my qualifications best and which of them will also give me enough free time to attend to my other side hustles and, at the same time, leisure. Let me say for instance that they both need a community manager or support that can be active in one of their social channels. I will go with Uniswap (a decentralized exchange) because they have fewer complaints daily than centralized exchanges like Binance.

Assuming the payment or salary is the exact same amount every month which one will you prefer to work for and why? You have to see what skills do you have and what are their job requirements (tasks) for you.You did not describe what you will do for them, like a customer service support (I guess).Quote from: Nwada001 on March 21, 2023, 12:22:12 PMLet me say for instance that they both need a community manager or support that can be active in one of their social channels. I will go with Uniswap (a decentralized exchange) because they have fewer complaints daily than centralized exchanges like Binance.Exchanges will do their customer support via support tickets officially opened at their websites.Customer support via social media channels are very vulnerable to scammers and impersonators and I am sure those channels if used for customer support, are only supplementary channels, not main ones.Few complaints from DEX and CEX, are you sure? It depends on many factors like how many customers they have, how smooth or laggy, buggy their platforms are as those factors contribute a lot to needs of customer support and complaints.

comments.author: Grim_Fandango
comments.body: I would chose the place where I see I have more room for improvement and career building, whether they are decentralized or centralized wouldn't be any factor for me when it comes to job.

comments.author: moneystery
comments.body: Honestly I would prefer to work with Binance over Uniswap. I'm not saying that Binance is better than Uniswap, both of them have the best service for me, but Binance seems more rational to choose compared to Uniswap because most people know Binance better than Uniswap, especially since Binance is a large multi-national company and has worked at this company was a good experience for me, so I will choose Binance.However, if the decentralized exchange is quite popular like Uniswap, and the centralized exchange is not popular, I prefer to work on Uniswap. It's not about working at DEX or CEX, it's about the credibility of which company I work for.

comments.author: Iadegbola34
comments.body: Choosing Binance is a no-brainer. We all know how much having a working experience with Binance boost your CV with future employers. Aside the confidence boost, Binance is the bigger and you will have enough room for improvement.

comments.author: touseefahmad1999
comments.body: If you were to decide between working for a DEX or a centralized exchange, it would depend on your personal preferences and skills. Working for a DEX would require knowledge of blockchain technology, smart contracts, and decentralized finance (DeFi) protocols. On the other hand, working for a centralized exchange would require knowledge of traditional financial systems, trading, and risk management

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: Quote from: FirmWars on March 21, 2023, 12:16:10 PMIf you are called upon to work for a decentralized exchange like Uniswap or Binance exchange which is a Centralised exchange, which offers will you grant yes? Assuming the payment or salary is the exact same amount every month which one will you prefer to work for and why? Payment/salary is very important to consider before taking a job, so also are some other factors. If two companies offer you a job with same amount as pay, you automatically begin to consider other things so you know which of them will be better for you to work in. Some examples of these other things to consider are;- If you are required to work offline, you consider the proximity and distance from your house to both offices and how far you will have to go everyday.- Working hours.- Working environment if it is an offline job too.Considering these factors since salary is the same can help in your decision making process.

comments.author: coolcoinz
comments.body: Assuming both jobs would be the same, I'd get the same hours, the same position, same paycheck, I'd choose a decentralized exchange simply because I don't trust CZ too much and I'd rather work for something that fits my attitude towards the crypto space.That said, I wouldn't ignore an offer from a centralized exchange if there was no other, or if the salary was twice what the decentralized one would offer. We're talking about a legit company that I don't suspect of foul play offering me a well paid job. You'd have to be very dumb or very rich to walk out on that

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: FirmWars on March 21, 2023, 12:16:10 PMIf you are called upon to work for a decentralized exchange like Uniswap or Binance exchange which is a Centralised exchange, which offers will you grant yes? Assuming the payment or salary is the exact same amount every month which one will you prefer to work for and why? Joining a team or company that shares the same vision and goal with you is the pathway to job satisfaction and fulfilment. Working because of money could lead to frustration. I don't believe in the centralization of cryptocurrencies because it could lead to loss of funds and privacy invasion. It will be self deception to work for a company you don't believe in. I will gladly work for a decentralized platform even if the pay is lower than that of the centralized exchange. Since the salaries are the same it it will be a great pleasure to be part of a team that promotes privacy and upholds the principle of becoming your own banks. If you are a strong believer of decentralization, you must act what you believe in.
